meanings.definition: The quality or state of being deeply rooted or established.
meanings.sent1: Her inveteracies in gardening were evident from the lush, well-tended flower beds.
meanings.sent2: The inveteracies of tradition were hard to change in the small village.
meanings.sent3: Despite his inveteracies in procrastination, he managed to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent4: The inveteracies of the ancient oak tree symbolized strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The inveteracies of the old building told stories of generations past.

meanings.definition: A habitual or longstanding practice or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His inveteracies in daily exercise kept him fit and healthy.
meanings.sent2: The inveteracies of her morning routine included a cup of coffee and a brisk walk.
meanings.sent3: The inveteracies of his sweet tooth often led him to the candy store.
meanings.sent4: Her inveteracies in kindness made her a beloved member of the community.
meanings.sent5: The inveteracies of his bad habits were hard to break.
